New Records: The Cleveland Guardians clinched a Major League Baseball playoff spot with a 3-2 win in 10 innings against the Twins, securing their 17th playoff appearance in franchise history.
Andrés Giménez drilled an RBI single for Cleveland's second straight walk-off victory, marking his fourth career walk-off plate appearance and second this season.
Guardians rookie Joey Cantillo pitched into the fifth inning and the bullpen tossed 5 2/3 scoreless innings, holding the Twins hitless and striking out eight.
Guardians rookie Kyle Manzardo hit his fourth home run and second of the series, opening the scoring with a changeup from Twins starter Simeon Woods Richardson into the seats in right.
Key Match Events: The game went into extra innings, with the Guardians tying the score in the bottom of the sixth inning after loading the bases against Minnesota lefty Cole Irvin.
The Twins threatened in the top of the 10th inning but were unable to score, thanks to a pop to first base by Carlos Correa and a fly ball to Lane Thomas in right for the final out.
Cleveland tied the score at two runs apiece in the bottom of the sixth after a sacrifice fly to center by Brayan Rocchio.
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians were not a popular pick to reach the playoffs but spent the last 23 weeks perched atop the American League Central Division, yielding sole possession of the division’s top spot for only one day, when they shared the position with Kansas City last month.
Manager Stephen Vogt said until he saw Giménez’s line drive hit green grass, he had not allowed himself to get excited about reaching the postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Vogt expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win, highlighting the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Cantillo praised the team's unity and determination, emphasizing that the Guardians never give up.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians improved the best home record in the AL to 48-28 with the win.
The Twins' pitcher Caleb Thielbar earned his third win while losing for just the second time in his last 14 appearances.
